ygData.subject: Re: Restoring Memories --> Tyrael, Bloodblade, Darkangel
ygData.msgSnippet: Tyrael nodded slightly. Tyrael: Good intel job, I must admit. Let s hope the Maximals won t discover it. However, if he is indeed who he claims to be, he

Tyrael nodded slightly.

Tyrael: Good intel job, I must admit. Let's hope the Maximals won't 
discover it. However, if he is indeed who he claims to be, he 
shouldn't be such a threat. If he isn't... I guess we'll use the ship 
against him. Now, I finished the Tripredacus access to the gun, and I 
need you to deliver it to the site. It wait in the lab, so be quick 
about it.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Polar Claw <cycodrone@y...> wrote:
> "While you were running the restoration program on our
> friend over there, I decdied to run a background check
> on that Giant Maximal we discovered while meeting with
> the Maximals not long ago. Interfacing with the
> computers, and uploading the image of him, the
> computer fed me back his data file. As for finding out
> about his claims, I secretly hid a bug not far from
> the Maximal base in case it yielded anything about the
> new bot. As it transmits its signal back through
> subspace, the orbital interference array was not an
> issue." Darkangel patiently awaited his leader's
> reply.
> 
>  --- Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote: 
> ---------------------------------
> OOC: Lol! That's borderline, but let's see how you do!
> 
> Bic:
> 
> Tyrael: How did you get to know all this?
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Polar Claw
> <cycodrone@y...> wrote:
> > The significance of this discovery was not lost on
> > Darkangel.
> > 
> > "I guess this raises the question of just who we can
> > and cannot trust.  A major wildcard is a Maximal
> > warrior by the name of Shadowcaster who according to
> > all records died defending the Ark during Megatron's
> > attack using the Nemesis. He claims to be sent back
> > from the Matrix by Primus, whic if true means he
> could
> > well be a good option to turn to should the weapon
> > fail. On the other hand, if this is really a hoax by
> > Unicron then I fear we are all in danger. Assuming
> he
> > is the spawn of Unicron, even if we were able to
> foil
> > his ruse, he is as powerful as Optimal Optimus,
> > however, much faster, and with cloaking
> capabilities.
> > Whatever the case, it would seem that our problems
> are
> > increasing." 
> > 
> >  --- Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote: 
> > ---------------------------------
> > Tyrael was grave yet again.
> > 
> > Tyrael: A file appeared. It was labelled as a .UCR
> > file. Logically, 
> > if Maximal files are labelled .MAX, Preds as .PRD
> and
> > Tripredacus 
> > as .TRP, then I figure that .UCR means he is a
> Minion.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Polar Claw
> > <cycodrone@y...> wrote:
> > > Darkangel wasted no time in activating the
> failsafes
> > > of the CR Tanks and geting him out of there as
> fast
> > as
> > > he possibly could. Something was not right- Tyrael
> > was
> > > not prone to rash action- whatever he just found,
> it
> > > must have been something worthy of some serious
> > worry.
> > >  Brisky walking over to Tyrael, he decided that
> > > whatever it was, they were all best prepared if
> they
> > > knew exactly what they were dealing with.
> > > 
> > > "What is it? What did you discover?" 
> > > 
> > >  --- Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote: 
> > > ---------------------------------
> > > In his sorrows, Bloodblade noticed a flash on him
> > and
> > > suddenly 
> > > focused on it. Void? Pain? What was going on?
> > > 
> > > Tyrael was curious at what was heppening, when
> > > suddenly, a file 
> > > appeared on the screen. The designation made him
> > > doubt, then sent a 
> > > chill in his body.
> > > 
> > > Tyrael: By the Matrix! Darkangel! Drag him out of
> > the
> > > base now!
> > > 
> > > 
> > >
